annotation.TEXT: Current status: Fire Mario, with a reserve mushroom and green Yoshi.
Jump over the Chuck that falls down the stairs here, and stick out Yoshi's tongue just to make sure I didn't get knocked off him.
BGM: Dr. Mario - Fever
Obviously, I wasn't lined up correctly, so I gotta do it again.
Try to land on this cement block right here, then wait. (Though if you're fast enough, you could go the whole distance in one shot.)
26, which makes my total the answer to life, the universe, and everything.
Now just be patient here. Wait for the blocks to be in the right position.
It seems the castle has crumbled from my sheer awesomeness!
Once you're through, there's a Dry Bones on the right (go left, and hopefully he won't hit you), and two of them on the level above (cape spin like mad once you're up there).
The two Thwimps at the start are tricky, but it's right at the beginning of the level, so if I get hit, I'll just restart (since I savestate between levels).
There are a lot of Mega Moles in this level, but Yoshi should be able to eat up any that are in my path if I'm careful!
Yoshi could be helpful if I miss a jump somewhere, but I really want to hang on to him as long as possible since he could be helpful in removing enemies.
Made it, and I got all the Yoshi coins too!
You could try running jumps, but when you can't see yourself, it's kind of hard.
Interesting...
Mole just after this small pit, and another one that comes down the stairs up ahead. Back away from those stairs a bit so it doesn't land on you!
I wonder where that Star Road leads.
BGM: Alien Vs. Predator - Stage 4
D'oh! I obviously crashed into the parakoopa here. Fortunately, Yoshi can't fall off the level here, so if I repeatedly hop in place...
Now, with the sprites turned off, I'm going to need to go by memory and somehow "feel" my way around each level.
BGM: Castlevania 3 - Riddle
I'll use any clues I can to help determine my position.
BGM: Mega Man 4 - Final Wily Battle
Obviously, I fell back down. Let's try that again.
The side area's simple enough to get through.
Alright, it's boss time! Whoa, Morton's not a sprite! Interesting... Well, shoot two fireballs at him and then stomp him once to win.
...I should eventually land on him again! (Got lucky that I landed on him quickly there!)
Okay, for the next level, I'm going to head for the Valley of Bowser. Let's see what happens with that graphical oddity in the corner as I travel...
I thought there would be a mole on this path here, but it's not there now, so whatever...
Oof! Obviously, I missed with the stomp... Come on, I don't want to lose now!
If you land on the springboard, jump keep bouncing until the opening is lined up. If you don't go through, then you're not lined up properly. Just hop off and keep adjusting until you get it.
How many stars did I get?
I have no idea where the red koopa is, but I know I knocked him over with a block.

There's a mole a little bit after this vine block. Also, don't dawdle here, or an additional Chuck will drop down here from the upper-left. For the final Chuck before the exit, the ice blocks should give his position away!
SMW challenge from illusion115: Complete three levels with the sprite layer turned off. One level must be Yoshi's Island 3, and one must be a castle.
MOOOOOONNN!!!!! It's not ultra vital, but the time it takes to collect the moon will be enough for a mole to have moved out of your way when you drop down.
I never got hit or grabbed any power ups in the last level, so I'm still a fireball-spewing maniac with a backup fungus in storage!
This part is tricky. If you move fast though, the turn block bridges should all be stretched out horizontally as you reach them, greatly improving your chances of making it!
Good, I got him with a turn block. Next, just carefully climb up the right side when there are openings.

Then, try to jump on the springboard. If you think you missed (as I believe I did), just run all the way to the right, then jump and run all the way to the left. This should allow you to grab the springboard wherever it is, and you can try again.
D'oh! I tried to do a running jump there, but failed. If you fall, don't panic. Just climb back up again. You should have enough time to afford a few mistakes.
It's interesting what you might discover with the sprites turned off, like this graphical oddity up here!
Okay, this ledge up here has a springboard and a Dry Bones somewhere on it. First jump towards the ledge and keep cape spinning until you whack the Dry Bones.
Remember where your X position is to help with this jump, and you can do a test jump straight up just to be sure.
How many stars this time?
I've restarted a few times there, not just from failing to stomp the Dry Bones, but also one time because I failed to get in the door before it woke up and smacked me!
I'm taking the lowest route here, and there is a mole in this passage.
If you made it this far, clearing the level now shouldn't be too tough.
After giving that Chuck a splitting headache, just go right and exit!
It's weird how a block of the background behind Mario in the corner was actually a sprite!
It helps to know my approximate X position when just moving normally to the right. I should be slightly to the left of my reserve item box (in the red column).

Got him. I could tell because I heard the sound effect, and my score went up by 100. Now, run all the way to the left. You should pick up the spring board on the way. Then move a few steps right and drop the springboard.
With this vertical shaft, figuring out your X position is not easy, but this first part isn't too bad.
Yes! Got him! Whew! Without the flower, that would've taken three stomps, and you saw (sort of) how much trouble I had with one!
For the Thwomps and the Podoboo, listen for sound cues (and watch for screen shakes in the Thwomp cases).
Ah, 16. Not that I need them or anything...
Mole a little bit after the indent in the ceiling.
Hi, Yoshi... I think...
Challenge complete! Now, I know that it was probably hard to tell what was going on at times, so let me know if I should upload a video of this gameplay with the sprites visible.
(Note: You might not actually see the screen shake in this video because of YouTube's frame rate.)
Mole above midpoint. If you want to hit midpoint, eat this mole first, or it might land on you as you come back this way after hitting midpoint.
This fire flower can help later, so I'm going to try not to lose it!
I may not be able to see myself, but if I continue holding left here, I'll know that I'm up against the wall, and when I can jump up.
Nailed them. Now climb up carefully. Maybe get a feel for your position by hitting the ? blocks.
At the top, thwack one more Dry Bones. Then, if you still have your flower, try to switch to it. It'll help with the boss.
As for the Ball 'N Chains, just don't jump and keep moving right, and they should all miss.
There we go! Now hopefully, you'll smack the next Dry Bones with one of the turn blocks. If you don't, just keep cape spinning when you get up there.
I walked up to the right wall, then backed up a few steps, hit select, then moved left again to get it!
Now there's a Dry Bones at the end of this room, and there's no easy way to determine its location, so I just duck jump instinctively and hope I stomp it.
Mole on the upper path here. It's a dead end, but if I don't eat it now, it might sneak up behind me when I take the lower path.
Okay, Valley of Bowser 1, start! (Also, I guess the "Mario Start!" message is a sprite too!)
BGM: Zelda: Oracle of Seasons - Unicorn's Cave
Okay, the last level has to be a castle, so I'll try Morton's.
Mole on the munchers.
Managed to get my reserve cape...
I just jumped where I thought I needed to, and somehow got lucky!
Okay, for this next part, all I can say is good luck! Even I'm not exactly sure how I got past this!
This time, I'll be more patient.
Make sure you get the cape. You WILL want it. Trust me!
